{"step_by_step_thinking": "Hyponatremia is a condition that occurs when the level of sodium in your blood is abnormally low. Sodium is an electrolyte, and it helps regulate the amount of water that's in and around your cells. The normal range for blood sodium levels is 135 to 145 milliequivalents per liter (mEq/L). If the sodium in your blood is lower than 135 mEq/L, it is considered hyponatremia.", "answer_choice": "A"}
